briefdescription.para: Allow incompatible changes to the schema.

detaileddescription.para: Incompatible changes can cause failures when attempting to read older data files. For example, adding a required column and attempting to read data files without that column will cause a failure. However, if there are no data files that are not compatible with the change, it can be allowed.

This option allows incompatible changes to be made to a schema. This should be used when the caller has validated that the change will not break. For example, if a column is added as optional but always populated and data older than the column addition has been deleted from the table, this can be used with RequireColumn() to mark the column required.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, std::shared_ptr< Type > type, std::string_view doc="")
memberdef.name: AddColumn

briefdescription.para: Add a new optional top-level column with documentation.

detaileddescription.para: Because "." may be interpreted as a column path separator or may be used in field names, it is not allowed in names passed to this method. To add to nested structures or to add fields with names that contain ".", use AddColumn(parent, name, type, doc).
If type is a nested type, its field IDs are reassigned when added to the existing schema.
The added column will be optional with a null default value.

parameterdescription.para: Name for the new column.
Type for the new column.
Documentation string for the new column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name contains ".".

memberdef.argsstring: (std::optional< std::string_view > parent, std::string_view name, std::shared_ptr< Type > type, std::string_view doc="")
memberdef.name: AddColumn

briefdescription.para: Add a new optional column to a nested struct with documentation.

detaileddescription.para: The parent name is used to find the parent using Schema::FindFieldByName(). If the parent name is null or empty, the new column will be added to the root as a top-level column. If parent identifies a struct, a new column is added to that struct. If it identifies a list, the column is added to the list element struct, and if it identifies a map, the new column is added to the map's value struct.
The given name is used to name the new column and names containing "." are not handled differently.
If type is a nested type, its field IDs are reassigned when added to the existing schema.
The added column will be optional with a null default value.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the parent struct to which the column will be added.
Name for the new column.
Type for the new column.
Documentation string for the new column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if parent doesn't identify a struct.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string_view name, std::shared_ptr< Type > type, std::string_view doc="")
memberdef.name: AddRequiredColumn

briefdescription.para: Add a new required top-level column with documentation.

detaileddescription.para: Adding a required column without a default is an incompatible change that can break reading older data. To suppress exceptions thrown when an incompatible change is detected, call AllowIncompatibleChanges().

Because "." may be interpreted as a column path separator or may be used in field names, it is not allowed in names passed to this method. To add to nested structures or to add fields with names that contain ".", use AddRequiredColumn(parent, name, type, doc).
If type is a nested type, its field IDs are reassigned when added to the existing schema.

parameterdescription.para: Name for the new column.
Type for the new column.
Documentation string for the new column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name contains ".".

memberdef.argsstring: (std::optional< std::string_view > parent, std::string_view name, std::shared_ptr< Type > type, std::string_view doc="")
memberdef.name: AddRequiredColumn

briefdescription.para: Add a new required column to a nested struct with documentation.

detaileddescription.para: Adding a required column without a default is an incompatible change that can break reading older data. To suppress exceptions thrown when an incompatible change is detected, call AllowIncompatibleChanges().

The parent name is used to find the parent using Schema::FindFieldByName(). If the parent name is null or empty, the new column will be added to the root as a top-level column. If parent identifies a struct, a new column is added to that struct. If it identifies a list, the column is added to the list element struct, and if it identifies a map, the new column is added to the map's value struct.
The given name is used to name the new column and names containing "." are not handled differently.
If type is a nested type, its field IDs are reassigned when added to the existing schema.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the parent struct to which the column will be added.
Name for the new column.
Type for the new column.
Documentation string for the new column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if parent doesn't identify a struct.

briefdescription.para: Rename a column in the schema.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to rename using Schema::FindFieldByName().
The new name may contain "." and such names are not parsed or handled differently.
Columns may be updated and renamed in the same schema update.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to rename.
Replacement name for the column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change conflicts with other additions, renames, or updates.

briefdescription.para: Update a column in the schema to a new primitive type.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to update using Schema::FindFieldByName().
Only updates that widen types are allowed.
Columns may be updated and renamed in the same schema update.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to update.
Replacement type for the column (must be primitive).

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change introduces a type incompatibility or if it conflicts with other additions, renames, or updates.

briefdescription.para: Update the documentation string for a column.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to update using Schema::FindFieldByName().

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to update the documentation string for.
Replacement documentation string for the column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if the column will be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Update a column to be optional.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to mark optional.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Update a column to be required.

detaileddescription.para: This is an incompatible change that can break reading older data. This method will result in an exception unless AllowIncompatibleChanges() has been called.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to mark required.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Delete a column in the schema.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to delete using Schema::FindFieldByName().

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to delete.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change conflicts with other additions, renames, or updates.

briefdescription.para: Move a column from its current position to the start of the schema or its parent struct.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to move.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change conflicts with other changes.

briefdescription.para: Move a column from its current position to directly before a reference column.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to move using Schema::FindFieldByName(). If the name identifies a nested column, it can only be moved within the nested struct that contains it.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to move.
Name of the reference column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change conflicts with other changes.

briefdescription.para: Move a column from its current position to directly after a reference column.

detaileddescription.para: The name is used to find the column to move using Schema::FindFieldByName(). If the name identifies a nested column, it can only be moved within the nested struct that contains it.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the column to move.
Name of the reference column.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change conflicts with other changes.

briefdescription.para: Applies all field additions and updates from the provided new schema to the existing schema to create a union schema.

detaileddescription.para: For fields with same canonical names in both schemas it is required that the widen types is supported using UpdateColumn(). Differences in type are ignored if the new type is narrower than the existing type (e.g. long to int, double to float).
Only supports turning a previously required field into an optional one if it is marked optional in the provided new schema using MakeColumnOptional().
Only supports updating existing field docs with fields docs from the provided new schema using UpdateColumnDoc().

parameterdescription.para: A schema used in conjunction with the existing schema to create a union schema.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.
InvalidState will be reported if it encounters errors during provided schema traversal.
InvalidArgument will be reported if name doesn't identify a column in the schema or if this change introduces a type incompatibility or if it conflicts with other additions, renames, or updates.

briefdescription.para: Set the identifier fields given a set of field names.

detaileddescription.para: Because identifier fields are unique, duplicated names will be ignored. See Schema::identifier_field_ids() to learn more about Iceberg identifier.

parameterdescription.para: Names of the columns to set as identifier fields.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the case of schema needs to be considered when comparing column names.

parameterdescription.para: When false case is not considered in column name comparisons.

simplesect.para: Reference to this for method chaining.

briefdescription.para: Return the kind of this pending update.
Apply the pending changes to the original schema and return the result.

detaileddescription.para: This does not result in a permanent update.

simplesect.para: The result Schema and last column id when all pending updates are applied.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::optional< std::string_view > parent, std::string_view name, bool is_optional, std::shared_ptr< Type > type, std::string_view doc)

Whether the column should be optional (true) or required (false).

briefdescription.para: Assign a new column ID and increment the counter.

memberdef.definition: Result< std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< const SchemaField > > > iceberg::UpdateSchema::FindField
memberdef.name: FindField

briefdescription.para: Find a field by name using case-sensitive or case-insensitive search.

memberdef.definition: Result< std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< const SchemaField > > > iceberg::UpdateSchema::FindFieldForUpdate
memberdef.name: FindFieldForUpdate

briefdescription.para: Find a field for update operations, considering pending changes.

detaileddescription.para: This method checks both the original schema and pending updates/additions to return the most current view of a field. Used by operations that need to work with fields that may have been added or modified in the same transaction.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the field to find.

simplesect.para: The field if found in schema or pending changes, nullopt otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Normalize a field name based on case sensitivity setting.

detaileddescription.para: If case_sensitive_ is true, returns the name as-is. If case_sensitive_ is false, returns the lowercase version of the name.

parameterdescription.para: The field name to normalize.

simplesect.para: The normalized field name.

briefdescription.para: Find a field ID for move operations.
Internal implementation for recording a move operation.
API for schema evolution.

detaileddescription.para: When committing, these changes will be applied to the current table metadata. Commit conflicts will not be resolved and will result in a CommitFailed error.
TODO(Guotao Yu): Add support for V3 default values when adding columns. Currently, all added columns use null as the default value, but Iceberg V3 supports custom default values for new columns.
